Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: first I need to understand the standard steps of P2P The usual sequence is create requisition approve issue PO receive goods invoice match pay payments close case Each step must follow in order

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with case 1001 Create Purchase Requisition at 0800 Then Approve at 0815 Next is Issue PO at 0900 Then Receive goods at 1000 Then Vendor Invoice Received at 1130 Match Invoice to PO at 0900 Release Payment at 1000 Close Case at 1500 Seems okay so far

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Case 1002 Create requisition at 0830 Approve at 0840 Issue PO at 0900 Vendor Invoice Received Release Payment Approve Purchase Requisition Receive Goods Match Invoice to PO Close Case Wait line by line Wait no Wait actually many corrections on sequence and timestamps

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: case 1003 Create Purchase Requisition Approve Purchase Requisition Issue Purchase Order Release Payment Vendor Invoice Received Receive Goods Match Invoice to PO Close Case payment before invoice and goods possible anomaly

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: case 1004 Create Purchase Requisition Approve Purchase Requisition Receive Goods Issue Purchase Order Vendor Invoice Received Match Invoice to PO Release Payment Close Case many Wait recheck timestamps sequence order reversed

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In case 1004 after approving requisition receive Goods before issuing PO is incorrect Normally after approving create requisition issue PO then receive goods Receiving goods before PO issued is anomalous problematic because cannot receive goods for unissued PO

Name: Validation - PE
Text: confirms sequence in 1004 Receive Goods before Issue PO standard requires PO before goods receipt also notes early payment in 1003
